alert.note: Alert for Chaves; Curry; Roosevelt (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued October 02 at 3:11PM MDT until October 02 at 4:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Roosevelt County in east central New Mexico... Northeastern Chaves County in southeastern New Mexico... Southwestern Curry County in east central New Mexico... * Until 415 PM MDT. * At 311 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles west of Elida to near Kenna, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Portales, Melrose, Elida, Floyd, Dora, Saint Vrain, Cannon Air Force Base, Kenna, Oasis State Park, and Portair. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 353 and 383. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Heavy rains from severe thunderstorms can produce sudden and dangerous flows in arroyos, ditches and over low water crossings. Do not attempt to drive through areas where water covers the roadway.
